name: howler
content:
howler noun [C]
(MISTAKE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
a stupid and obvious mistake, especially in something that someone says or writes: I called her by the name of his first wife, which was a bit of a howler. So far in the election, no candidate has committed a shocking howler.
More examplesFewer examplesThanks to all readers alert enough to spot the howler.It avoids the embarrassing howlers that a press conference can create.Even those punctilious about punctuation can commit the odd grammatical howler.

howler noun [C]
(BEER CONTAINER)
US informal a jug or large bottle that can be filled with beer, especially at a brewery (= a place where beer is made). A howler usually contains 32 fluid ounces: Howlers are perfect if you're looking to bring home multiple draft beers but don't want a full growler of each. Compare
growler (BEER CONTAINER)
More examplesFewer examplesHowlers are half the size of growlers.Each howler includes three cans of the finest craft beer.He came home from work clutching a howler of beer.
